summary: externs/es3.js missing optional flags for Date.UTC - causes warning in closure library.

comments.content:
Using closure library, I see:

closure-library/closure/goog/i18n/timezone.js:209: WARNING - Function 
Date.UTC: called with 5 argument(s). Function requires at least 7 
argument(s) and no more than 7 argument(s).
  var timeInMs = Date.UTC(date.getUTCFullYear(), date.getUTCMonth(),
                         ^

Mozilla documentation says all arguments but year and month are optional.
Adding @param {number=} for the others should do the trick. I do not know if 
the method would take strings, too.
This issue was closed by revision r98.
